summary: The Don Young American Grown Act mandates that cut flowers and greens displayed in public areas of specific federal buildings (Executive Office of the President, Department of State, and Department of Defense) must be produced in the United States.  The bill defines "cut flower," "cut green," and "produced in the United States."  It includes provisions relating to areas under US jurisdiction and specifies a one-year delayed effective date. Personal display by federal employees is excluded.
